answers.answer: Unexplained fever needs complete evaluation with blood tests like CBC which includesHemoglobin,neutrophils,platelets,hematocrit,ESR,Widal,Malaria,Dengue serology.Since you come from a community prone for such diseases in this season,take the person to a Doctor who can check her completely to see all possible infections.Avoid taking more Paracetamol since it not only causes side effects but also have little value if it is a infection.It controls only fever or mild pain.

Has she had a CBC done? It could be a viral infection... Of course, there are many reasons for low grade fever... It just means her body is responding to a threat... New med, Autoimmune problems, urine infection.  No sense jumping to all the worst things... Have her get some blood work... CBC, Basic Metabolic Panel, Hepatic Function Panel and a Urinalysis and culture. Let us know how it goes

question: I know a person who has a low grade continuous fever with weakness for last 7 days. No chills and rigor, no sweating. She feels weakness in her limbs. the fever subsides only when she takes antipyretics(paracetamol). She is 45 years old. She has developed bronchial asthma some months back. She does not have hypertension and diabetes mellitus. What are the possible causes?
title: Fever: low grade, continuous, no chill and sweat with weakness
